caption: b'This #GivingTuesday, Newell Brands and the Newell Brands Charitable Foundation are celebrating our 2020 Local Impact Grant Program recipients. The Local Impact Grant Program (LIGP) is funded by the Newell Brands Charitable Foundation and puts the power of giving into the hands of our employees, enabling them to nominate and vote on nonprofits to receive grants each year. This year\xe2\x80\x99s 25 recipients make an impact near ten of our locations in North America. The grants will be used to fund projects and activities that support our giving pillars of child safety and development, education, hunger, outdoor play & the environment and diversity & inclusion. Check out the full video at the link in our bio for a few special words from some of our recipients and the employees who nominated them!\n\n#newellbrands #wearenwl #giveatnwl #givingtuesday #philanthropy #csr #giveback #dogood #community #supportlocal'

b'More than 500 CEOs agree: \xe2\x80\x9cEvery American has a voice in our democracy. Voting should be safe and accessible to all. Elections should be fair and transparent.\xe2\x80\x9d At Newell Brands, we are proud to be part of the Civic Alliance, a non-partisan group of businesses working together to build a future where everyone participates in shaping our country.:ballot_box_with_ballot: #CivicAlliance #fordemocracy CivicAlliance.com/100

b'On this episode of Leaders Live!, Beth Stellato, VP of Corporate Communications at Newell Brands,  speaks with Nora Gilbert of @votedotorg . Vote.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, non-partisan voting registration and get-out-the-vote technology platform. The Newell Brands Charitable Foundation recently made a donation to Vote.org to fund sending SMS messages directly to low-propensity voters.

During this conversation, Nora shares important information on the resources offered through Vote.org, things people should take into consideration if they plan to vote this year and more! Tune in to the full episode on our YouTube channel under the Leaders Live playlist to make sure you are informed and prepared for the upcoming election. Link in bio.

Visit Vote.org for more information.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #vote #wearenwl #voterrights #civicduty'

b'Newell Brands and Sharpie:registered: are honored to have donated three million @sharpie markers to under-resourced teachers through @kidsinneed Foundation and its National Network of Resource Centers with #SharpieForSuccess. This donation will provide new markers to\xe2\x80\xafhundreds of teachers\xe2\x80\xafnationwide supporting creativity in their classrooms. Many teachers within the Kids In Need Foundation network are under-resourced and spend between 1 to 2 paychecks on average on supplies for their classrooms each year. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support these amazing, dedicated educators with tools they can use to inspire artistry, creativity and self-expression in their students. Thank you teachers nationwide for your commitment to our students! 
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #giveatnwl #kidsinneed #teachers #educators #sharpie #giveback #dogood'

b'Newell Brands is proud to join the Civic Alliance alongside over 350 member companies in the effort to champion civic participation, meet the unique challenges of the 2020 election and build momentum for higher voter turnout this November and beyond. The Civic Alliance is a non-partisan business coalition that strengthens our democracy by supporting safe, healthy and trusted elections and inspiring every American to participate, and we echo Civic Alliance\xe2\x80\x99s belief that the strength of the United States lies in its people, each with the power and potential to shape the future of the country. Today\xe2\x80\x99s companies have  the platform and reach to encourage and inspire every American to speak up and engage in civics, starting with voting in every election.
 
We are honored to take the Pledge alongside Unilever, Target and other companies as a non-partisan alliance and commit to the following:
 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Encourage our American audiences to participate in elections

\xe2\x80\xa2 Empower our U.S. employees to vote and be civically active

\xe2\x80\xa2 Champion civic engagement opportunities in our U.S. communities
 
Visit civicalliance.com for more information.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #vote #wearenwl #voterrights #civicduty #voterregistration'

b'#CelebratingLatinxHeritage 
Meet Liz Rueda Fuentes, a Training & Capabilities Manager for Newell\xe2\x80\x99s Marketing Operations Team , originally from Colombia. She\xe2\x80\x99s lived all over the world and has used those experiences, combined with her Latin heritage to develop the great appreciation she has for culture, and the great attitude she has towards challenging experiences. 

\xe2\x80\x9cI love traveling and have had the opportunity to live in various countries, which gave me a great appreciation for learning about different cultures and a better understanding of my own heritage. My favorite aspects of my Latin heritage are resilience and a positive outlook, even during challenging times while growing up in my native country of Colombia.\xe2\x80\x9d 

As a Latina and an American, Liz says she embraces cultural diversity, especially during Latinx Heritage Month, \xe2\x80\x9cwhich brings us together to continue to enrich each other\xe2\x80\x99s perspectives from all backgrounds.\xe2\x80\x9d 

When asked about her biggest role model, Liz shared how her mother has inspired her. \xe2\x80\x9cShe is the definition of a kind, hard-working and resilient woman who has taught me so much through her example in everything she does. I strive to be consistently reliable in all facets of my life as she has been for me. Now that I myself am a proud mother of two amazing spunky little ones, I want to be a good example by being fully present in these special moments.\xe2\x80\x9d 

Thank you to Liz and our other dynamic employees for sharing their voices and stories with us this month! 
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CelebratingLatinxHeritage #latinxheritagemonth #newellbrands #wearenwl #lifeatnwl #colombia'

b'Every 24 seconds, a fire department responds to a fire. Given this alarming statistic along with the fact that many homes have recently transformed into makeshift offices, gyms and even classrooms, home safety has become even more of a priority. Here are some safety tips from our @firstalert First Alert:registered: brand in honor of #FireSafetyMonth!:

1. Check your smoke and carbon monoxide alarms regularly \xe2\x80\x93 just press the button and wait for the beep, replace the batteries every 6 months or upgrade to 10-year sealed battery alarms to eliminate battery replacements for a decade

2. Make sure these alarms are on every level of your house and in every bedroom

3. Unattended cooking is the number 1 cause of home fires \xe2\x80\x93 make sure you have fire spray

3. Plan and practice your home escape plan \xe2\x80\x93 then repeat.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #firstalert #firesafetymonth #fireprevention #smokealarm #smokedetector'

b'Last month, our @rubbermaidcommercialproducts and Commercial teams in Huntersville, North Carolina held their annual Give Week, where they work together to make an impact in their local community. The teams volunteered for local nonprofits in the Huntersville area through in-person, socially distanced and virtual volunteer projects. Over 75 employees gave back to seven local nonprofits including @classroomcentral, @adajenkinsnc, @shmetrolina, @habitatforhumanity, @cardzforkidz, @urbanministrycenter, and @coolkidscampaign_clt for a combined total of 270 hours of service. Congratulations to the Rubbermaid Commercial Products and Commercial teams! We are #newellproud.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #rubbermaid #commerical #rcp #dogood #giveback'

b'In honor of #LatinxHeritageMonth, we are featuring some of our Latinx employees. Meet Maria Weintraub, a Senior Manager of Human Resources for Newell Brand\xe2\x80\x99s Appliances & Cookware Team based in Boca Raton, FL.
 
\xe2\x80\x9cWhat I love the most about my career is that throughout my almost 17 years at Newell Brands, every role has been filled with new lessons and I have continuously been challenged. On top of this, I am truly passionate about our brands. I don\xe2\x80\x99t take for granted that every day I drive and keep my two boys safe in @graco car seats, cook meals in @calphalon cookware and personally know the people and process behind the @osterkitchen air fryer we can\xe2\x80\x99t live without. How cool is that?
 
I was born and raised in Colombia. Like in many other Latin countries, a small family gathering is defined as inviting 40 people at a minimum. I love how we live and breathe family, and this is a top priority as I raise kids of my own.  Second is music. Nothing like a great merengue, vallenato or salsa to get you in the best possible state of mind. And impossible for me not to mention soccer and the passion for it. The nerves we experience during home country games are intense!\xe2\x80\x9d
 
Thank you, Maria for sharing your story with us! Be sure to check back here to meet more of our Latinx employees this month.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CelebratingLatinxHeritage #latinxheritagemonth #newellbrands #wearenwl #lifeatnwl #colombia #graco #oster #calphalon #globalbrands'

b'We are proud to share that our President & CEO, Ravi Saligram, has signed the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion:trade_mark: pledge! CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion is the largest CEO-driven business commitment to advance diversity and inclusion within the workplace. Recognizing that change starts at the executive level, we believe this is an important step towards advancing diversity and inclusion in the workplace and solidifying our commitment alongside other prominent companies to cultivate trusting workplaces that allow for complex, and sometimes difficult, conversations; implement and expand unconscious bias education; share best\xe2\x80\x94and unsuccessful\xe2\x80\x94practices; and create and share strategic inclusion and diversity plans with our Board of Directors. 
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #WeAreNWL #diversityandinclusion #ceoaction #change #leadership'

b'The Newell Brands Charitable Foundation made a donation to Vote.org , a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, non-partisan voting registration and get-out-the-vote technology platform, to fund sending SMS messages directly to low-propensity voters. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support their non-partisan work to help Americans learn how to register to vote, verify their voter registration status and provide registration links, deadlines, polling location details and other essential voting information for each state. At Newell Brands, we believe that all individuals should have access to clear, accurate and understandable information and resources related to the voting process, and we are committed to doing our part as an organization to ensure our employees have the resources they need to register and vote if they choose to do so.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #vote #wearenwl #voterrights #civicduty'

b'On the latest episode of Leaders Live!, Beth Stellato, VP of Corporate Communications at Newell Brands, speaks with Rachel Sprecher, Executive Director, Office of Partnerships and Development at Atlanta Public Schools about the impact of COVID-19 and the back-to-school season. Atlanta Public Schools (APS) has been a nonprofit partner of Newell Brands since 2015. Since then, Newell has donated over 1 million products, including @paper_mate pens and pencils;\xe2\x80\xaf@sharpie Sharpie markers, @elmersproducts Glue\xe2\x80\xafand @graco baby gear, benefiting nearly 40,000 students and their families. Join Beth and Rachel as they discuss the work the APS team is doing to prepare for an uncertain school year, the challenges for families navigating a back-to-school season amidst a pandemic, and how you too can get involved with supporting APS.

Check out the full episode on our YouTube channel under the Leaders Live! Playlist. Link in bio.

#newellbrands #wearenwl #giveatnwl #giveback #dogood #nonprofitpartners #backtoschool #importantdiscussions'

b'In honor of Hunger Action Month this September, Crockpot:trade_mark: is partnering with Feeding America:registered: to help provide as many as 250,000 meals to individuals and families in need. Millions of Americans are currently struggling with food insecurity and unemployment due to the pandemic, and @crockpot \xe2\x80\x98s donation will assist Feeding America in providing meals to vulnerable households across the country.

Hunger Action Month is a time when people all over America stand against hunger. Sharing, volunteering, pledging to advocate, and fundraising are just a few ways to take action this month. You can visit https://www.feedingamerica.org/take-action/hunger-action-month to learn more and get involved.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2

b'Today on #WomensEqualityDay, we are honored to celebrate the many women in history and the movements they led that ensured the suffrage rights we have today. August 26th marks the 100th anniversary of women\xe2\x80\x99s right to vote through the ratification of the 19th amendment. However, the reality at the time was far from equal for all women and we must recognize and acknowledge the challenges that Black Americans, Native Americans, Latinx people and Asian immigrants still faced during this time of commemoration.  Influential Black women leaders like Ida B. Wells, Harriet Tubman and Mary Church Terrell were instrumental in paving the way for equity and justice for all. There is still much work that needs to be done to address issues of voter disenfranchisement and more, but today we celebrate all of the strong women in history, and their male allies, who opened the gates to equality and set the path for those who came after them. Stay tuned for more content this week on the history of the women\xe2\x80\x99s movement. 
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #womensequality #womensequalityday #womeninleadership'

b'On this episode of Leaders Live!, our Newell Brands\xe2\x80\x99 podcast, Beth Stellato, VP of Corporate Communications, talks with Deborah Menkart, Executive Director of Teaching for Change. The Newell Brands Charitable Foundation recently partnered with Teaching for Change to support their early childhood, anti-bias education work. The nonprofit provides teachers and parents with the tools to create schools where students learn to read, write and change the world. As Deborah shares during the interview, \xe2\x80\x9cSchools should be places where children begin to create the world they want to live in.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
During their conversation, Beth and Deborah discuss anti-bias and racial equity education, the importance of selecting inclusive reading material for children, struggles on the path to equal voting rights and more. Listen now, and stay tuned for the next two episodes in our series highlighting Newell Brands\xe2\x80\x99 nonprofit partners.

Click the link in our bio to listen to this informative episode.
\xe2\x80\xa2

\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #giveatnwl #giveback #dogood #racialjustice #equity #importantdiscussions'

Edsel and Christopher, you are #frontlineheroes and we\xe2\x80\x99re honored that you have chosen to spend your careers at Newell Brands. Thank you for your incredible commitment and hard work!'

b'Employees in our Home Fragrance business in Blairs, VA stepped up to show their resounding support for coworker, Zina White, as she fights her battle against breast cancer. The team recently recognized Zina as "Employee of the Month" and presented her with a certificate, candles, and a monetary gift.

When asked how she is staying strong during this difficult time, Zina said, "I can't let the disease I have get me down and keep me from living life. If you give up on yourself the disease will take over and I'm determined to win this battle. My coworkers are a wonderful support system because they keep me from feeling defeated."
 
Thank you to the Newell Brands Home Fragrance Team for recognizing and supporting Zina, and to Zina, we are behind you 100%!
 
#newellbrands #wearenwl #newellfamily #homefragrance #culture #dogood #beatcancer'

b'This year, we launched the Newell Brands Sustainability Excellence Awards to honor our commitment to sustainability and recognize our teams around the world who find creative and innovative ways to advance our goals locally. This year\xe2\x80\x99s first-place award was presented to our team in Maryville, TN, where we manufacture Sharpie products.

Since 2013, the Maryville team has made annual sustainable improvements within their 750,000 sq. ft. facility, resulting in a reduction of over 120,000 pounds of waste, 355 tons of greenhouse gasses, and generating thousands of dollars in energy savings. The team also created a training program dedicated to reducing waste directed to landfills in which approximately 800 employees have participated.

We are so proud of our Maryville team\xe2\x80\x99s progress and commitment to operating more sustainably.

Congratulations, team!
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #sustainabilityatnwl #wearenwl #sharpie #papermate #writingbrands #gogreen #csr'

b'This year, Coleman, one of our iconic outdoor brands is celebrating 120 years! In 1900, The Coleman Company was formed when W.C. Coleman began designing a gas-powered lantern \xe2\x80\x93 the rest was history. Since then, Coleman has been part of numerous households, family gatherings and outdoor activities. From lanterns and camp stoves, to the latest Skydome tents and OneSource technology, Coleman has continued to create innovative gear to help make lasting outdoor memories.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2

b'#GiveAtNWL Since 2000, America SCORES Chicago, has delivered free after-school and summer programming that combines three equally fun and powerful activities: soccer, poetry and service-learning. During this time of uncertainty, they are committed to being a trusted resource for the Chicago community. They\xe2\x80\x99ve conducted wellness checks of more than 400 homes in the SCORES community, providing families with information about how to access resources to support the health, well-being, and continued learning of children in the household, and have distributed hot spots to homes where students lack reliable internet access.

We are proud our Chicago-based employees selected America SCORES Chicago to receive a grant from the Newell Brands Charitable Foundation through our 2019 Local Impact Grant Program. We believe investing locally is the key to sustainable change and we\xe2\x80\x99re honored to support America SCORES and the terrific work they do in Chicago. 
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #giveatnwl #giveback #dogood'

b'Rubbermaid:registered: has partnered with international recycling leader, TerraCycle:registered:, to provide a recycling solution for well-used food storage containers. Rubbermaid food storage products help keep food fresh to reduce waste and are made to enable a long life of reusability. Partnering with TerraCycle will allow the brand to create an even more sustainable product lifecycle. Through the Rubbermaid Food Storage Recycling Program, consumers can now ensure all plastic and glass food storage containers have a sustainable end to their lifecycle and can recycle these containers for free by visiting https://www.terracycle.com/rubbermaid-food-storage .\n\n#newellbrands #sustainabilityatnwl #wearenwl #rubbermaid #recycling #reducefoodwaste'

b'Launched in 2019, the Newell Brands Local Impact Grant Program (LIGP) puts the power of giving into our employees\xe2\x80\x99 hands. Employees in participating offices and facilities nominate a nonprofit for a grant from the Newell Brands Charitable Foundation and the selected nonprofits receive funding for programs and initiatives that align with our strategic giving pillars. As we launch the 2020 program, we want to highlight our 2019 recipients and the amazing work that was done in their communities with the grants they received. 
 
\xe2\x80\x9cThanks to the Newell Brand\xe2\x80\x99s Local Impact Grant Program, we are improving the quality of our STEAM program to help us achieve our goal hiring an additional STEAM instructor to provide engaging activities in science, technology, engineering, art and math,\xe2\x80\x9d said Janet Wallach, Director of Program Development, Boys and Girls Club of Hudson County.

We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support organizations in our local communities, like the Boys and Girls Club of Hudson County, that are meaningful to our employees.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #wearenwl #giveback #dogood #community #csr #steam #stem'

b'Newell Brands has a long history of not precluding job applicants from employment based on conviction information that is not relevant to our hiring process. We were pleased to join other Atlanta-based companies such as The Home Depot and Coca-Cola in publicly supporting Georgia state Senate Bill 288 (SB 288). The Bill which passed both the Georgia state House and Senate on Wednesday afternoon would expand opportunities for individuals to have their prior records restricted, as it relates to certain misdemeanor convictions, and aid in reducing barriers to employment. This will create economic opportunity for countless Georgians currently being left behind, who want to progress in their careers, provide better futures for their families, and contribute to their communities. We believe this is a step in the right direction in criminal justice reform and providing opportunities for more people who might otherwise not have them. \n#newellbrands #WeAreNWL #justice #reform #equalopportunity #fairemployement'

b'Today, we celebrate Juneteenth, an annual commemoration of the emancipation of enslaved Africans in the United States. We encourage our employees and followers to take some time to learn more about this important day, reflect and volunteer or give back. The Newell Brands Charitable Foundation is making a donation to Teaching for Change, a nonprofit building social justice starting in the classroom and providing teachers and parents with the tools to create schools where students learn to read, write and change the world. Check out our IG Story for highlights about this historic day and ways you can show support and honor Juneteenth.\n\n#Juneteenth #WeAreNWL #equality #justice'

b'The US Supreme Court ruled Monday that discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity is illegal under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act. At Newell Brands, we\xe2\x80\x99ve long rejected discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity and stand in solidarity with our LGBTQ+ employees and community in celebrating this victory. We remain committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace and supporting our LGBTQ+ employees.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
#pridemonth #celebratepride #equalitymatters #wearenwl #LoveWins'

b'In our recent Corporate Social  Responsibility Report, Newell Brands shares our commitment to making a difference locally and globally and an important part of this is putting the power of #giving in our employees\xe2\x80\x99 hands.  We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to announce the launch of our 2020 annual Local Impact Grant Program. The program is an employee-driven initiative funded by the Newell Brands Charitable Foundation whereby employees in selected locations nominate nonprofits to receive grants and then vote on finalists.  Last year, 36 nonprofits, chosen by our employees, received a grant from the program. We look forward to seeing the nonprofits that our employees are passionate about and we will share updates about the program and grant recipients over the coming months!  To learn more about some of last year\xe2\x80\x99s recipients, check out the link in our bio.'

b'#CelebrateEarthDayEveryday :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:\nSustainability continues to play an important role in the outdoor industry with Marmot:registered:. The brand combines functionality and eco-consciousness to produce sustainable products such as The Marmot:registered: EVODry products, which are completely free of perfluorinated chemicals and made from upcycled yarn. Compared to new yarns, EVODry fabrics uses less petroleum and energy. Additionally, its waterproofing treatment doesn\xe2\x80\x99t use any water whatsoever and minimizes waste. Featherless is a high performance insulation produced using recycled plastic as an alternative to natural down sourced from geese and ducks. We are proud of @marmot and its commitment to #sustainableliving! #newellbrands #WeAreNWL #marmot #sustainabilityatNWL #earthday2020'

b"In honor of #NationalVolunteerWeek our @FirstAlert team showed their appreciation towards volunteer fire departments across the country. They donated 1,000 First Alert rechargeable fire extinguishers to the National Volunteer Fire Council (NVFC) to help the efforts in minimizing at-home fire risk. Like so many others during this time, first responders are facing challenges like never before so it is particularly important that people are equipped and knowledgeable on fire safety. This donation will help volunteers/departments registered with the NVFC's Fire Corps program to make an immediate impact in the fire readiness of their communities. Thank you to all first responders:police_car_light: for your bravery and dedication! :clapping_hands:

Research shows that Americans throw away billions of dollars\xe2\x80\x99 worth of food each year, costing the average American family over $2,000 per year. b'Our frontline employees are the backbone of our company, and we could not go with saying a huge thank you to them during this unusual and challenging time globally.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Meet Art McNulty, an Environmental, Health, Safety & Facility Manager. Known for his \xe2\x80\x9ccan-do\xe2\x80\x9d attitude and positive spirit, Art has embraced the challenges of this new reality.
\xe2\x80\xa2
What\xe2\x80\x99s helping keep spirits up during this time? 
Here\xe2\x80\x99s what Art has to say: \xe2\x80\x9cI like challenges and results. The in between is why we are at work. When a team can come together solving problems and working to protect everyone\xe2\x80\x99s livelihood, it is priceless. This applies to protecting ourselves through a crisis (COVID19), making huge improvements in the manufacturing process, or implementing other cost reductions. It has worked for 35 plus years.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you, Art, for all that you are doing and making sure our people are safe and healthy! You rock!'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWe recognize the role our products play in your daily lives\xe2\x80\x94from food preservation and workplace sanitation to childcare and relaxation with home fragrances\xe2\x80\x94and their importance in these uncertain times,\xe2\x80\x9d said Newell Brands President & CEO Ravi Saligram in an open letter on COVID-19 and the business. \xe2\x80\x9cAs we respond to the ongoing situation, we are doing everything possible to deliver excellent support to our partners and delight our consumers while prioritizing the health and wellbeing of our employees.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\xa2\nClick the link in our bio to read the full letter.'

b'#CelebratingWomensHistoryMonth

Kris Malkoski is the CEO of our Food Business Unit, and one of the many phenomenal women leaders at Newell Brands.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Her favorite thing about being a woman? \xe2\x80\x9cI love being the \xe2\x80\x9cglue\xe2\x80\x9d that keeps everything and everyone moving forward!\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Her \xe2\x80\x9csuperpower\xe2\x80\x9d? \xe2\x80\x9cI know how to laugh and to stay positive. No matter how difficult a day can be, I can find a way to smile.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Kris also shared words of wisdom for women no matter where they are on their career journey: \xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t worry about who you are or where you have come from, worry about making a difference in everything you do\xe2\x80\xa6and you\xe2\x80\x99ll do great!

There have been many challenges over the years, [but] I find that a challenge is like climbing a mountain. It looks huge and daunting but if you break it down into steps and complete one step after the next, you can get to the top!\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
To her, a great leader means possessing the qualities of empathy, integrity, accountability, resilience, vision, creativity & positivity. Kris notes one of her proudest career accomplishments as being that people tell her she\xe2\x80\x99s made a positive impact in their lives, and that previous employees from all the companies she\xe2\x80\x99s worked at stay in touch.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you Kris, for your inspiring words and wisdom!'

b'Do you know about our Design Center in Kalamazoo, MI? It\xe2\x80\x99s a dynamic hub of creativity and innovation where talented and passionate people bring some of our best products to life! 
Savannah Walters is a Senior Industrial Designer at the Center and to celebrate Women\xe2\x80\x99s History Month she shared a bit about one of her favorite women in design, who inspires her in her own creativity and work:
\xe2\x80\x9cEdith Heath and her husband founded Heath Ceramics. She was the driving force behind the creative. She even crafted her own clay body. I think she pulled some of the aspects of the clay from her local region, and her clay body could be fired at a lower temperature, saving energy. They still use that same formula today.
The craftsmanship is beautiful: the exposed edges and incredible glazes. It can be a simple object but it feels like it\xe2\x80\x99s had a life. Being able to stand the test of time is something I really love about her work.\xe2\x80\x9d
You can follow @nwldesign for more on their Women in Design series this month. And, be sure to check out our IG Stories for some more inspirational women in history!'

b'March is Women\xe2\x80\x99s History Month and all month long we\xe2\x80\x99ll be celebrating the voices, work, history and experiences of women. Check out these beautiful works of art celebrating women using our brand @prismacolor \xe2\x80\x98s colored pencils! (all artists tagged)'

b'#CelebratingBlackHistory Liana Charles is a Packaging Engineer in R&D, who shared with us how she feels her cultural heritage helped to shape who she is today, who she's most inspired by, and what Black History means to her.
\xe2\x80\xa2
"To me, Black History Month is a time to reflect on some of the greatest achievements and advancements in black American history. \xe2\x80\xa2
I\xe2\x80\x99m really inspired by several black American inventors, who\xe2\x80\x99ve created some of the most commonly used tools, mechanisms, and products of our time. Madam C.J. Walker created an African American hair care line in 1905, that is still in the market today and is now used by men and women of all backgrounds with textured hair. I\xe2\x80\x99m always inspired to rethink the impossible because of her story, so I can leave a legacy behind of solving problems to help people!"
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #WeAreNWL #LifeAtNWL #employeesmatter #culture #engagement #diversityandinclusion'

b'Meet Antonya Asante, an Associate Manager of Brand Communications \xe2\x80\x93 Social Media Strategy at Newell Brands. She\xe2\x80\x99s a proud Texan who grew up riding horses in rodeos and trail riding in Houston and surrounding areas.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cMy grandfather is Creole and helped found one of the first African American trail ride associations that still participates in the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo. My dad is keeping the tradition going, and in his free time helps educate people locally and on television features about the history of black cowboys in the US and Texas.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
What Black History Month means to Antonya?
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cTo me, Black History Month is a moment when all Americans can take time to reflect on, remember, and celebrate the contributions of African Americans that have helped to make this country great. But it also, in my opinion, is an exciting way to inspire others to keep making contributions to our country\xe2\x80\x99s future.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands\xc2\xa0#celebratingblackhistory\xc2\xa0#WeAreNWL\xc2\xa0#LifeAtNWL\xc2\xa0#culture\xc2\xa0#employeesmatter\xc2\xa0#diversity\xc2\xa0#inclusion'

b'In honor of Black History Month, we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to feature some of our dynamic members of the BEACON (Black Employees Achieving Connecting and Operating in Newell) employee resource group. They shared their voices on what Black History Month means to them, their inspirations and unique backgrounds.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Meet Al Kamara, Talent Acquisition Leader originally from Guinea, Conakry, West Africa: \xe2\x80\x9cBlack History Month, to me, means remembering and celebrating the legacy and honor of the many civil right leaders that have made it possible for me to live and work as an American. I am from a culture that values education, hard work, integrity, respect and honor. As a young professional, I have been blessed to work with companies with values that align with mine.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
What does he love most about Newell?
\xe2\x80\x9cThe people, our Talent Acquisition Team in particular, we are very close, caring, supportive and fun. I also love our products and am very excited about Newell\xe2\x80\x99s future!\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Be sure to check out more of these spotlights here and on our LinkedIn, and take a peek at our Instagram stories for some fun Black History facts you may not have known!
\xe2\x80\xa2
#newellbrands #celebratingblackhistory #WeAreNWL #LifeAtNWL #culture #employeesmatter #diversity #inclusion'
